segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it's making me angry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman just keeps drying those dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is getting bigger and bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children in the background, but they seem more interested in the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and the water is just pouring down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dish towel she's using looks so ordinary, but her actions are anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's going to slip on that wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, unlike the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting at her to turn around and see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, but the water is the real issue here.
segments.speaker: PAR
